alert.note: Alert for Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 11 at 2:12PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following counties, Lexington and Richland. * WHEN...Until 415 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 211 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms that were nearly stationary over downtown Columbia. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia, West Columbia, Cayce, Forest Acres, St. Andrews, Oak Grove, West Columbia Riverwalk, Riverbanks Zoo, Five Points, SC State Fair Grounds, Guignard Park, Eau Claire, Olympia, Rosewood and Seven Oaks. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 65 and 68. Interstate 26 between mile markers 108 and 111. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
